events.message: The customer reported an auto collision that occurred on April 30th involving their car and a street pole.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident following a review of the initial report and related documents.
A claims agent was assigned promptly to assist the claimant and expedite the claim process.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the claim and informed the customer about next steps.
The claimant was requested to submit photos of the damaged vehicle and a police report for further assessment.
The claimant uploaded all requested documents, including detailed images showing front bumper and headlight damage.
An investigation into the auto accident circumstances was initiated to verify liability and estimate damages.
The investigation concluded the claimant was not at fault, and damage estimates were finalized for the repair costs.
A settlement offer covering full repair costs and a rental car reimbursement was proposed to the claimant.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling and fair terms of the settlement offered.
The claim was officially approved following the claimant's acceptance of the proposed settlement terms.
Payment was transferred to the claimantâ€™s account, covering all approved repair expenses and additional allowances.
With the payment completed and satisfaction confirmed, the auto accident claim was officially closed.
